NEWAH has designed WASH projects, in four VDCs, from two districts, Tanglichowk and Phinam of Gorkha district and Jaljala and Bhakunde of Baglung district. The area has been identified in close coordination with DDC’s recommendation and on the basis of community demand.The project will provide safe drinking water service,environmental sanitation and to promote good and sustainable hygiene practices. Interventions target the poorest and most vulnerable people, households and communities.

Service delivery, Capacity building and Advocacy, in WASH sector, are the three major components to intervene in the project. Environmental Sanitation, Preventive Health, New/ improved water supply, Livelihood, Climate Change and use of GSI sensitive approach are key deliverables of the project.

Social dimensions like, gender, caste, cultural barriers will be considered during the project implementation. NEWAH will use the gender, equity and social inclusive approach to address such dimensions and incorporate the needs of different disadvantage group of people.

The current contract is an integral part of the proposal “Water, Health and Sanitation for Better Life”, as signed by Simavi and NEWAH on 26 February 2010, for the period 2010 - 2012. The proposal for 2012 has been developed in cooperation with the Nepal WASH Alliance and concerns an integrated programme for 2012, funded by both Simavi and RAIN Foundation.
